title: John Betts (Canadian politician)
text:
John Willis Betts, (born February 17, 1949) is a <a href="Canadians">Canadian</a> teacher and politician, who was a member of the <a href="Legislative%20Assembly%20of%20New%20Brunswick">Legislative Assembly of New Brunswick</a> for the <a href="Riding%20%28division%29">riding</a> of <a href="Moncton%20Crescent">Moncton Crescent</a> from 1999 to 2014.
Betts was born in <a href="Moncton">Moncton</a>, <a href="New%20Brunswick">New Brunswick</a>. He earned an <a href="ice%20hockey">ice hockey</a> scholarship to <a href="Gordon%20College%20%28Massachusetts%29">Gordon College</a> in <a href="Boston">Boston</a>, <a href="Massachusetts">Massachusetts</a> and graduated with a <a href="Bachelor%20of%20Science">Bachelor of Science</a> degree. He went on to earn a <a href="Bachelor%20of%20Education">Bachelor of Education</a> and a <a href="Master%20of%20Education">Master's Degree in Education Administration</a> from the <a href="University%20of%20Moncton">University of Moncton</a>.
Betts was a longtime member of the <a href="Moncton%20City%20Council">Moncton City Council</a>, having been elected in 1986, 1989, 1992, 1995 and 1998. He resigned from council upon his election to the legislature in <a href="1999%20New%20Brunswick%20general%20election">1999</a>. He was re-elected to the legislature in <a href="2003%20New%20Brunswick%20general%20election">2003</a> and <a href="2006%20New%20Brunswick%20general%20election">2006</a>.
He sits as a <a href="Progressive%20Conservative%20Party%20of%20New%20Brunswick">Progressive Conservative</a>. From 2003-2006, his party held only a one-seat majority which could have collapsed upon the long term absence of any of its members. Betts, who previously had a <a href="Coronary%20artery%20bypass%20surgery">quadruple heart bypass</a> in 1994, was hospitalized in early 2005 with what was thought to be a minor <a href="Myocardial%20infarction">heart attack</a> forcing the government to delay several votes. Betts since returned to work in good health having only suffered severe <a href="indigestion">indigestion</a>.
On December 7, 2005, he was named <a href="deputy%20speaker">deputy speaker</a> replacing <a href="Trevor%20Holder">Trevor Holder</a> who had been elevated to the <a href="Executive%20Council%20of%20New%20Brunswick">cabinet</a>. He ceased being deputy speaker on August 18, 2006 with the <a href="dissolution%20of%20parliament">dissolution of the legislature</a> for a general election.
